description: Default values for airflow. Declare variables to be passed into your templates.

airflowHome.description: Airflow home directory. Used for mount paths.

defaultAirflowRepository.description: Default airflow repository. Overrides all the specific images below.

nodeSelector.description: Select certain nodes for airflow pods.

affinity.description: Select certain nodes for airflow pods.

tolerations.description: Select certain nodes for airflow pods.

labels.description: Add common labels to all objects and pods defined in this chart.

web.description: Configuration for the Ingress of the web Service.

path.description: The path for the web Ingress.

host.description: The hostname for the web Ingress.

enabled.description: Enable TLS termination for the web Ingress.

secretName.description: The name of a pre-created Secret containing a TLS private key and certificate.

precedingPaths.description: HTTP paths to add to the web Ingress before the default path.

succeedingPaths.description: HTTP paths to add to the web Ingress after the default path.

flower.description: Configuration for the Ingress of the flower Service.

path.description: The path for the flower Ingress.

host.description: The hostname for the flower Ingress.

enabled.description: Enable TLS termination for the flower Ingress.

secretName.description: The name of a pre-created Secret containing a TLS private key and certificate.

precedingPaths.description: HTTP paths to add to the flower Ingress before the default path.

succeedingPaths.description: HTTP paths to add to the flower Ingress after the default path.

airflowPodAnnotations.description: Extra annotations to apply to all Airflow pods.

rbacEnabled.description: Enable RBAC (default on most clusters these days).

allowPodLaunching.description: If this is true and using LocalExecutor/SequentialExecutor/KubernetesExecutor, the scheduler's service account will have access to communicate with the api-server and launch pods. If this is true and using the CeleryExecutor, the workers will be able to launch pods.

env.description: Environment variables for all airflow containers.

fernetKey.description: The Fernet key used to encrypt passwords.

ccacheMountPath.description: Path to mount shared volume for kerberos credentials cache.

ccacheFileName.description: Name for kerberos credentials cache file.

configPath.description: Path to mount krb5.conf kerberos configuration file.

keytabPath.description: Path to mount the keytab for refreshing credentials in the kerberos sidecar.

principal.description: Principal to use when refreshing kerberos credentials.

reinitFrequency.description: How often (in seconds) airflow kerberos will reinitialize the credentials cache.

replicas.description: Number of airflow celery workers in StatefulSet.

enabled.description: Allow KEDA autoscaling. `Persistence.enabled` must be set to false to use KEDA.

pollingInterval.description: How often KEDA polls the airflow DB to report new scale requests to the HPA.

cooldownPeriod.description: How many seconds KEDA will wait before scaling to zero.

maxReplicaCount.description: Maximum number of workers created by KEDA.

storageClassName.description: If using a custom storageClass, pass name ref to all StatefulSets here.

fixPermissions.description: Execute init container to chown log directory. This is currently only needed in KinD, due to usage of local-path provisioner.

enabled.description: Enable Kerberos sidecar for the worker.

terminationGracePeriodSeconds.description: Grace period for tasks to finish after SIGTERM is sent from Kubernetes.

safeToEvict.description: This setting tells Kubernetes that it's ok to evict when it wants to scale a node down.

serviceAccountAnnotations.description: Annotations to add to the worker kubernetes service account.

replicas.description: Airflow 2.0 allows users to run multiple schedulers. This feature is only recommended for Mysql 8+ and postgres

airflowLocalSettings.description: This setting can overwrite podMutation setting.

safeToEvict.description: This setting tells Kubernetes that its ok to evict when it wants to scale a node down.

serviceAccountAnnotations.description: Annotations to add to the scheduler kubernetes service account.

replicas.description: How many Airflow webserver replicas should run.

webserverConfig.description: This will be mounted into the Airflow Webserver as a custom `webserver_config.py`. You can bake a `webserver_config.py` in to your image instead.

serviceAccountAnnotations.description: Annotations to add to the webserver kubernetes service account.

extraAnnotations.description: Extra annotations for the statsd service.

maxClientConn.description: Maximum clients that can connect to pgbouncer (higher = more file descriptors).

extraAnnotations.description: Extra annotations for the pgbouncer service.

ciphers.description: The allowed ciphers, might be 'fast', 'normal' or list ciphers separated with ':'.

key.description: Private key used to authenticate with the server

terminationGracePeriodSeconds.description: Grace period for tasks to finish after SIGTERM is sent from Kubernetes.

storageClassName.description: If using a custom storageClass, pass name ref to all StatefulSets here.

password.description: If password is set, create secret with it, else generate a new one on install.

safeToEvict.description: This setting tells Kubernetes that its ok to evict when it wants to scale a node down.

registry.description: Auth secret for a private registry. This is used if pulling airflow images from a private registry.

secretName.description: A secret containing the connection string.

limits.description: Define default/max/min values for pods and containers in namespace.

cleanup.description: This runs as a CronJob to cleanup old pods.

config.description: Settings to go into the mounted airflow.cfg

multiNamespaceMode.description: Whether the KubernetesExecutor can launch workers and pods in multiple namespaces

podTemplate.description: TODO ; also add type if you know it

enabled.description: Enable persistent volume for storing dags.

storageClassName.description: If using a custom storageClass, pass name here.

accessMode.description: Access mode of the persistent volume.

existingClaim.description: The name of an existing PVC to use.

maxFailures.description: The number of consecutive failures allowed before aborting.

subPath.description: Subpath within the repo where dags are located.

wait.description: Interval between git sync attempts in seconds.

uid.description: Git sync container run as user parameter.
